snippet: As international influenza experts looked at the possibility of human-to-human transmission, there was concern that the new virus may have originated in other animals.
abstract: China is investigating four possible cases of human-to-human transmission of deadly bird flu that has killed 17 people, but World Health Organization says so far there is 'no sustained' evidence of transmission between people; concern is mounting that new virus, known as H7N9, may not originate in poultry but in other animals.
lead_paragraph: As international influenza experts looked at the possibility of human-to-human transmission, there was concern that the new virus may have originated in other animals.

headline.seo: Investigators Search for Origin of Flu Strain
headline.main: Experts Look Beyond Birds in Investigation of Flu Strain in China
headline.print_headline: Experts Look Beyond Birds In Investigation of Flu Strain

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
